chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph C. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample & surcharge if not provided already.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  AODA/treatment per agent.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety of alcohol & controlled substances.  Random UAs.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: to any other commitment/sentence

records.addlTxt:
State by Atty John Newton.  Atty Woodard appears in person w/DE Joseph C Johnson, in custody.  Court states case and State states appearances and status.  Atty Woodard agrees/acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and pleads NC to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty and sentences.

Ct 1:  NC
36 months probation
Conditions of probation:
20 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
Fine/costs of $638.25 (including the $250 DNA surcharge) DNA sample to be provided
DNA sample doesn't need to be given if one already has been provided
Suspend DL 6 months concurrent to conviction
AODA/Treatment and any other conditions per agent
Absolute sobriety at all times from controlled substances and alcohol
Random urinalysis
Not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores or businesses selling drug paraphernalia
Cts 2 and 3:  Dismissed/read-in

14TR3125 and 14TR3126 are both dismissed

Plea/sentencing hearing on June 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on June 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on July 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph C. Johnson in court with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Defendant Joseph C. Johnson in custody.  Michael X Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Woodard advises court defendant is waiving prelininary hearing.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  Bond continues.  Matter resolved and request a plea date.  Plea to a felony.  Bond continues.  Get date from Br. 1.  Status hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on May 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Return date on June 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph C. Johnson by video from LEC with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Defendant Joseph C. Johnson in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Woodard responds.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $350.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to possess/consume any controlled substances w/o valid prescription and not to operate a MV w/o valid DL.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
